column1: t was further held as follows:
“Ar(cid:415)cle  138  is  an  enabling provision which  creates and grants jurisdic(cid:415)on  to the
Court of Appeal to hear appeals from Courts of First Instance, Tribunals and Other
Ins(cid:415)tu(cid:415)ons. It deﬁnes and delineates the jurisdic(cid:415)on of the Court of Appeal. It does
not,  nor  indeed  does  it  seek  to,  create  or  grant  rights  to  individuals  viz-a-viz
appeals. It only deals with the jurisdic(cid:415)on of the Court of Appeal and its limits and
its limita(cid:415)ons and nothing more. It does not expressly nor by implica(cid:415)on create or
grant any rights in respect of individuals.” [emphasis added; page 413]
